content:
Phishing Risk Analysis

Our analysis of the URL "http://secure-paypal.com.verification.dunsguide.org" has revealed a medium phishing risk, with a risk score of 55. This suggests that the URL exhibits several suspicious characteristics that warrant caution. While not definitively malicious, it's crucial to understand the potential risks before interacting with this site.

Key Risk Indicators

  • Suspicious Domain Name: The domain name "secure-paypal.com.verification.dunsguide.org" attempts to mimic PayPal by including "secure-paypal.com" within it. This is a common tactic used by phishers to deceive users into thinking they are interacting with a legitimate PayPal site. The actual domain belongs to "dunsguide.org," which is not related to PayPal.
  • Length of URL: The URL is relatively long (51 characters) and complex, which can be a sign of obfuscation. Phishers sometimes use long URLs to hide the true destination of the link or to make it appear more legitimate.
  • Multiple Dots in Domain: The presence of four dots (.) within the domain name is unusual for legitimate websites. This excessive use of dots can be an attempt to make the URL appear more complex and trustworthy, while actually masking its true nature.
  • Lack of SSL Certificate (HTTPS): The URL uses "http" instead of "https." HTTPS indicates a secure connection, encrypted to protect your data. The absence of HTTPS is a significant red flag, especially for a website supposedly related to financial transactions like PayPal.

Technical Assessment

The URL's structure is a primary concern. The domain "dunsguide.org" is the actual domain, while "secure-paypal.com.verification" are subdomains. This creates the illusion that the site is associated with PayPal when it is not. The excessive length and multiple dots contribute to this deceptive appearance. The lack of an SSL certificate (indicated by the "http" protocol) means any information entered on the site would be transmitted in plain text, vulnerable to interception. The analysis also revealed no evidence of the domain being recently registered, which could have been another indicator of a phishing attempt.

What This Means For You

If this website is indeed a phishing site, interacting with it could lead to the compromise of your personal information. If you were to enter your PayPal login credentials, for example, those credentials could be stolen by the attackers. This could lead to unauthorized access to your PayPal account and potential financial losses. Other sensitive information, such as credit card details or social security numbers, could also be at risk.

Recommended Actions

  • Do not click on this link: Avoid interacting with this URL altogether. If you encountered it in an email or message, treat it with extreme suspicion.
  • Verify the website directly: If you need to access PayPal, always do so by typing the official URL (paypal.com) directly into your browser or using a trusted bookmark.
  • Report suspicious emails: If you received this URL in a phishing email, report it to PayPal and your email provider.
  • Check your PayPal account: If you have already clicked the link and entered any information, change your PayPal password immediately and review your recent account activity for any unauthorized transactions.
